paper_metadata.title: Does Patisiran Reduce Ocular Transthyretin Synthesis? A Pilot Study of Two Cases
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: ATTRv with neurological and ocular symptoms

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic testing confirmed a Phe64Leu (p. Phe84Leu) mutation on the TTR gene also in two brothers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Lower limb burning pain, progressive distal atrophy, diarrhea, orthostatic hypotension, glaucoma
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic testing for ATTRv, which determined a Val30Met (p.Val50Met) mutation.

functional_data.summary: The study assessed the effect of patisiran on TTR synthesis in serum and aqueous humor.

variants.segregation_data: The Phe64Leu mutation was confirmed in two brothers of Patient 1.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the limited effectiveness of patisiran in ocular TTR synthesis.
key_quotes: Genetic testing confirmed a Phe64Leu (p. Phe84Leu) mutation on the TTR gene also in two brothers.
Genetic testing for ATTRv, which determined a Val30Met (p.Val50Met) mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
